bug.author: amastrobera
bug.summary: object parser non compiling (wrong type cast)
bug.description:
carla/LibCarla/source/carla/opendrive/parser/ObjectParser.cpp
Line 73 in f2c3b9f
node_object.attribute("id").as_string(),
should be node_object.attribute("id").as_uint() and the same here
carla/LibCarla/source/carla/opendrive/parser/ObjectParser.cpp
Line 95 in f2c3b9f
node_object.attribute("id").as_string(),

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/amastrobera>@amastrobera</denchmark-link> please provide more context. Is this master, dev, which branch? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Axel1092>@Axel1092</denchmark-link> could you take a look?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/amastrobera>@amastrobera</denchmark-link> , it is parsed as string as the OpenDRIVE specifies that the object id is string type and not and only requires it to be unique: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35765780/94122109-6a27fb80-fe52-11ea-880e-8b5ce3212eb6.png></denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/germanros1987>@germanros1987</denchmark-link> it's in the master <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Axel1092>@Axel1092</denchmark-link> you declared the function AddSignal this way. It's expecting a SignId (alias for uint_32t). So, it's not a string and doesn't compile. I can contribute myself with a pull request (either changing all go strings or to SignId) if you add me as contributor. <denchmark-code> element::RoadInfoSignal* AddSignalReference( Road* road, const SignId signal_id, const double s_position, const double t_position, const std::string signal_reference_orientation); </denchmark-code>
carla/LibCarla/source/carla/road/MapBuilder.h
Line 154 in f2c3b9f
element::RoadInfoSignal* AddSignal(

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/amastrobera>@amastrobera</denchmark-link>
  is defined as string (see )
<denchmark-code>  using RoadId = uint32_t;

  using JuncId = int32_t;

  using LaneId = int32_t;

  using SectionId = uint32_t;

  using ObjId = uint32_t;

  using SignId = std::string;

  using ConId = uint32_t;

  using ContId = std::string;
</denchmark-code>

Can you further describe your problem? What are you attempting to do and any error logs that you may have so that we may find a solution together.
Apologies, my repo must have lost track of the updates on the RoadType.h file. You did it in February.
